content:
abrown opened PR #1413 from human-readable-encodings to master:

  • [x] This is something along the lines of what #955 is complaining about.
  • [x] A short description of what this does, why it is needed: it's difficult to understand what encodings are available; i.e., when codegen fails due to not finding an encoding for an instruction it is difficult to understand why. I think the idea started here could be extended with predicates to make it more useful--please let me know what else might be good to know in this type of listing.
  • [x] This PR contains no test cases.
  • [x] A reviewer from the core maintainer team has been assigned for this PR.
abrown requested bnjbvr for a review on PR #1413.
